meanings.definition: To make (soil) more fertile by adding nutrients
meanings.sent1: She enjoys fertilizing her garden to help the plants grow.
meanings.sent2: Farmers often use fertilizing to improve the quality of the soil.
meanings.sent3: The soil was so hungry, it begged for fertilizing to satisfy its appetite.
meanings.sent4: The idea of fertilizing the land with knowledge can yield a bountiful harvest of wisdom.
meanings.sent5: Fertilizing the soil is like giving it a nutritious meal to thrive.

meanings.definition: To make (an egg) capable of development by introducing sperm
meanings.sent1: The scientist explained how fertilizing an egg leads to the beginning of life.
meanings.sent2: In nature, fertilizing is essential for the continuation of many species.
meanings.sent3: The egg was surprised when it realized it needed fertilizing to hatch.
meanings.sent4: The concept of fertilizing an idea with creativity can give birth to innovation.
meanings.sent5: Fertilizing an egg is like planting a seed of potential.

meanings.definition: The act of adding nutrients to soil to promote plant growth
meanings.sent1: Fertilizing is important for ensuring the plants have enough food to thrive.
meanings.sent2: Gardening experts recommend regular fertilizing for a lush garden.
meanings.sent3: The competition for the best fertilizing technique at the gardening contest was fierce.
meanings.sent4: In the garden of life, friendship acts as a form of fertilizing for the soul.
meanings.sent5: The magic of fertilizing lies in its ability to transform a barren land into a flourishing oasis.
